searchDocs.title: 📥 Installation​
searchDocs.content: All modules are installable via Wally.

searchDocs.title: ⚙️ Wally Setup​
searchDocs.content: First, ensure Wally is installed. Then follow these steps:  Initialize Wally in your project: wally init Add the package you would like to install to your wally.toml file:  Example:  [dependencies] connections = "unknown91248/connections@0.0.2"   Install dependencies by running wally install in your project's terminal Wally will then create a /Packages folder which is where you will be requiring your scripts from.

searchDocs.title: 🚀 Usage Example (Connections module)​
searchDocs.content: local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage") local Connections = require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.connections) -- Create a new named connection local conn = Connections.NewConnection("TouchEvent", workspace.Part.Touched, function(hit) print("Touched by:", hit.Name) end) -- Start listening to the event conn:Connect() task.wait(5) -- Cleanup when done conn:Disconnect() conn:Destroy()

searchDocs.title: NewConnection​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections.NewConnection( name: string,-- The name you want to assign to the connection connectiontype: RBXScriptSignal ,-- The type of connection you want to use func: (any) → (any),-- The function to run when the connection is fired AutoConnect: boolean?-- If true then the connection will automatically connect to the function ) → table-- Returns the table so that it's functions can be called This is the function that creates the connection.

searchDocs.title: GetConnection​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections.GetConnection( Name: string-- The name of the connection you want to get ) → table | nil-- Returns the table so that it's functions can be called or nil, if it isn't found This connection retrieves a connection that was previously created so it makes it possible to run the connections functions via other scripts

searchDocs.title: Clean​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections.Clean() → () This function cleans up any connections that are in the "trash can", to add connections to the trash can you need to use the :AddToClean() function

searchDocs.title: Connect​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections:Connect() → RBXScriptConnection -- Returns the newly connected connection Connects the connection that was made.

searchDocs.title: Disconnect​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections:Disconnect() → () Disconnects the connection if it was previously connected.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections:Destroy() → () Cleans up/Destroys the connection that is no longer needed.

searchDocs.title: AddToClean​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections:AddToClean() → () This connection adds said connection to a "trash can" so that when the .Clean() function is ran, all the connections in the "trash can" would be destroyed

searchDocs.title: ForceRun​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections:ForceRun( ...: any-- any arguments ) → any-- Returns the function data This function allows you to force run the connection's given function with any arguments

searchDocs.title: ChangeFunction​
searchDocs.content: </> Connections:ChangeFunction( newfunc: (any) → any-- the function you want it to update to ) → () This function updates the connection's previous function to the newly set one.
